creator: vherilier@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 34635
config elements menu screenshot in 3.1 with all my config elements (GUI and BeanInfo ones)

Hi,

I just notice a regression about BeanInfo based generation for config elements, but sampler ones are not impacted.
I've no idea for other kind of elements.

Config elements generated from a BeanInfo based definition are no more generated (they do not appears in menu and elements in jmx files are no more recognized by JMeter).
I noticed that on the recent nightly build (Januray the 16th 2017).
Trying to investigate, I've found that already happens in r1772258 but not in 1770033 (Official 3.1 release).

I add 2 screenshots that shows the differences noticed between official 3.1 and last 3.2-SNAPSHOT.

I'm still investigating to found the root cause, and hopefully proposing a fix.
If you have an idea of where it is coming it will ease my contribution to JMeter.

Thanks in advance for your feedback and suggestions

Vincent

Created attachment 34636
config elements menu screenshot in 3.2-SNAPSHOT with only GUI config elements (BeanInfo ones are missing)
creator: vherilier@gmail.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello Vincent,
Do you have any error in jmeter.log ?
Thank you
Are you using a Java 8 to run JMeter 3.2 ?

Regards

Hi Philippe,

I'm currently using java 1.8 to launch both JMeter 3.1 and 3.2.
> $ java -version 
gives
> openjdk version "1.8.0_111"
> OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_111-b15)
> OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.111-b15, mixed mode)

I noticed no errors or warning in JMeter.log that could be related to this issue. I tried to switch JMeter output log level to DEBUG, but no traces catched my eyes about a possible related message.

3.2's jmeter.log shows only one difference with 3.1 one: a warning about ViewResultsFullVisualizer that has an error when loading JFXPanel class but I'm not sure that could be the root cause.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sorry for not providing you more information about that issue.

Tell me how I can help you investigating on it.

Thanks and regards

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text: Hi, can you attach jmeter.log for nightly ? thx

Hello Vincent,
The stacktrace is fine, it means you don't have JavaFX ?
What JDK are you using ? OpenJDK or Oracle ? Under which OS ?


Your issue is somewhere else.
Would it be possible to provide the code of one of your custom elements that have issues ?

Can you check that those classes do not rely on dropped classes or packages (see changes.xml)? :

https://github.com/apache/jmeter/blob/trunk/xdocs/changes.xml#L90

https://github.com/apache/jmeter/blob/trunk/xdocs/changes.xml#L81


Thank you ?
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
(In reply to Philippe Mouawad from comment #9)
> Hello Vincent,
> The stacktrace is fine, it means you don't have JavaFX ?
> What JDK are you using ? OpenJDK or Oracle ? Under which OS ?
> 
> 
> Your issue is somewhere else.
> Would it be possible to provide the code of one of your custom elements that
> have issues ?
> 
> Can you check that those classes do not rely on dropped classes or packages
> (see changes.xml)? :
> 
> https://github.com/apache/jmeter/blob/trunk/xdocs/changes.xml#L90
> 
> https://github.com/apache/jmeter/blob/trunk/xdocs/changes.xml#L81
> 
> 
> Thank you ?

Hi Philippe,

Right, I don't have JavaFX because I have to use OpenJDK. No related openJFX is available currently for the RHEL 6.5/6.8, I'm using to work with JMeter.
I hope RedHat will distribute java-1.8.0-oracle-openjfx soon to override this specific issue.

I found why my beaninfo config elements were not shown: they all implements TestListener and not TestStateListener. Switching the class reference solves the regression.

Thanks once again for your support.
creator: vherilier@gmail.com
